doc.title: Bank of Nanjing (A)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Bank of Nanjing A Stronger NII boosts PPOP higher CET1 amid CB dilution NeutralBank of Nanjing A Stronger NII boosts PPO_2025-08-29

passages.text: Maintain Rating: NEUTRAL | PO: 12.00 CNY | Price: 11.28 CNY

Bank of Nanjing (BONJ)'s net profit grew by \(8.8\%\) YoY in 1H25 to RMB12.6bn, accelerating from \(+7.1\%\) YoY in 1Q25. PPOP accelerated from \(+6.2\%\) YoY in 1Q to \(9.6\%\) YoY in 1H25. ROE - 1.1ppt YoY to \(15.0\%\) in 1H25. CET1 up 58 QoQ to \(9.47\%\) in 2Q on CB conversion. We make minor earnings changes, lower cost of capital by 100bp on the enhanced capital strength, and lower our PO by \(1\%\) to CNY12.0 (to reflect the dilution impact). Reiterate Neutral on its larger than peers' exposure to bond market fluctuations.

NII rose \(1.8\%\) QoQ, with gross interest income/expense up \(0.6\%\) /down \(0.2\%\) QoQ. Net fee income growth softened to \(+6.7\%\) YoY in 1H, vs. \(+18.0\%\) YoY in 1Q dragged by fee expense. Other non- interest income narrowed from \(- 12.2\%\) YoY in 1Q to \(- 7.6\%\) YoY in 1H and accounted for \(34\%\) of total income, vs. \(40\%\) in 1H24. Loan growth remained decent at \(15.0\%\) YoY or \(10.4\%\) HoH or \(3.0\%\) QoQ. Corporate/retail loans rose \(12.7\% /3.7\%\) HoH, for \(91\% /9\%\) of net new loans in 1H25, vs \(96\% /4\%\) in 1H24. Deposits fell by \(0.7\%\) QoQ, up \(16\%\) YoY from a low base. Loan- deposit ratio edged down 0.8ppt YoY to \(84\%\) Asset growth was \(4.9\%\) QoQ, \(16.9\%\) YoY. Revenue rose \(8.7\%\) YoY in 1H, operating cost up \(6.1\%\) YoY, positive operating leverage. CIR edged down 0.6ppt YoY to \(27.2\%\) in 1H25.

NPL size rose by \(3.9\%\) QoQ in 2Q25 with NPL ratio edging up by 1bp HoH to \(0.84\%\) Corporate loan NPL ratio was stable and low at \(0.65\%\) by 1H25 while retail loan NPL ratio rose by 14bp HoH to \(1.43\%\) . Write- off fell to 69bp in 1H25 from 108bp/84bp in 1H24/2H24. Gross NPL formation was at 87bp in 1H25, lower than 111bp/89bp in 1H24/2H24. Credit cost was 89bp in 1H25, lower from 93bp in 1H24 but higher than 86bp in 2H24. NPL coverage and LLR declined by 24ppt/17bp HoH to \(312\% /2.60\%\)

Banks-Multinational/Universal

BONJ was founded in 1996. It is one of the \(50+\) listed banks out of nearly 1,800 domestic banks nationwide, in addition to being the first city commercial bank listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange (2007). The bank introduced its first overseas strategic investor, International Finance Corporation (IFC), in 2001 and the second one, BNP Paribas (BNPP), in 2005. As of 3Q24, BONJ's assets amounted to RMB2,547bn, making it the fifth-largest city commercial bank in China.

We rate BONJ Neutral. BONJ has gone for consumption and bond trading business, which could benefit from consumption recovery as well as a lower rate environment. But we see increased non-interest growth pressure faced by the bank given the fluctuation of Treasury bond yield.

Our PO for BONJ is CNY12.0 (from CNY12.15), based on 0.77x 2025- 26E P/B (from 0.79x), which is derived from an adjusted Gordon Growth model that assumes a medium- term ROE of 11.7% (from 12.7%) on CB dilution, a medium- term growth rate of 4.0%, and a cost of equity (COE) of 14% on enhanced capital (from 15.0%). At our PO, the stock would be trading at 6.7x 2025- 26E P/E or 3.6x 2025- 26E P/PPOP.
Downside risks to our earnings forecasts and PO are a sharp margin decline, higher- than- expected NPL formation and credit costs, and reduced leverage due to higher capital adequacy requirement.
Upside risks to our earnings forecasts and PO are stronger- than- expected margin performance and lower- than- expected NPL formation

Investments in general and, derivatives, in particular, involve numerous risks, including, among others, market risk, counterparty default risk and liquidity risk. No security, financial instrument or derivative is suitable for all investors. Digital assets are extremely speculative, volatile and are largely unregulated. This information has been prepared independently of any issuer of securities mentioned herein and not in connection with any proposed offering of securities or as agent of any issuer of any securities. Any information relating to the tax status of financial instruments discussed herein is not intended to provide tax advice or to be used by anyone to provide tax advice. Investors are urged to seek tax advice based on their particular circumstances from an independent tax professional.

Subject to the quiet period applicable under laws of the various jurisdictions in which we distribute research reports and other legal and BofA Securities policy- related restrictions on the publication of research reports, fundamental equity reports are produced on a regular basis as necessary to keep the investment recommendation current.

Certain outstanding reports or investment opinions relating to securities, financial instruments and/or issuers may no longer be current. Always refer to the most recent research report relating to an issuer prior to making an investment decision.

In some cases, an issuer may be classified as Restricted or may be Under Review or Extended Review. In each case, investors should consider any investment opinion relating to such issuer (or its security and/or financial instruments) to be suspended or withdrawn and should not rely on the analyses and investment opinion(s) pertaining to such issuer (or its securities and/or financial instruments) nor should the analyses or opinion(s) be considered a solicitation of any kind.
